headline: SERA at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement
summary:
Skills and Relevant Experience 
â¢	Proven organization and time management through daily management of charter operations out of five hubs nationwide, schedule management, and supervisory duties in a high demand, quick-paced work environment.

â¢	Meticulous attention to detail has minimized paperwork problems for ICE Air Charter missions.			
â¢	Articulate and well-spoken- developed positive rapport with management, contractors, and field offices.

â¢	Experience in mission support functions, including purchasing, budget, WebTA actions, and hiring actions. 
â¢	Closely work with the Operations Research Analysts to identify ICE Air Charter Operations process inefficiencies.
â¢	Serve as the point of contact to management and field offices regarding any questions or errors on Air Charter flights.

defaultPosition.description:
â¢	Manage, schedule, and train Air Charter Operations (ACO) Enforcement and Removal Assistants (ERAs) and daily flight activities by managing WebTA actions, training and orientation of new employees, and HR actions.
â¢	Screen, interview, and recommend selections for new personnel.
â¢	Train new staff in daily flight operations, manifest procedures, and daily responsibilities. 
â¢	Develop and update ERA job duties, training materials, and SOPs.
â¢	Mentor, support, and provide daily guidance to employees. 
â¢	Evaluate employees work performance, prepare Performance Work Appraisals, and recommend awards, disciplinary actions, or training as appropriate.
â¢	Manage the Charter Flight Schedule; trained new personnel to update any new routes, new missions, and new updates to the schedule.
â¢	Assist and advise supervisor and office managers to provide solutions and recommendations for ICE Air Charter Operations.
â¢	Update Senior Federal Travel report and forward to management and HQ.
â¢	Manifest, review, and correct manifests, DAR reports, I-216s, and ICE Air Charter flight schedules.
â¢	Closely work with the Operations Research Analysts to identify ICE Air Charter Operations process inefficiencies.
â¢	Serve as the point of contact to management and field offices regarding any questions or errors on Air Charter flights.
â¢	Assist with Special High Risk Charter Flights (SHRCs) and inputting information in ECC.
â¢	Perform detainee history inquiries in EARM (Enforce Alien Removal Module) to identify gang affiliation and citizenship which required the analysis of various charging documents, detainer reports, and encounters.
â¢	Generate flight and charter schedules, spreadsheets, manifest, correspondence, reports, and reservations in order to prepare detainees for repatriation.
â¢	Create country clearance requests and communicate directly with multiple Attaches in order to determine necessary removal documents have been filled and or issued for detainees.
defaultPosition.title: SERA

positions.description:
â¢	Manage, schedule, and train Air Charter Operations (ACO) Enforcement and Removal Assistants (ERAs) and daily flight activities by managing WebTA actions, training and orientation of new employees, and HR actions.
â¢	Screen, interview, and recommend selections for new personnel.
â¢	Train new staff in daily flight operations, manifest procedures, and daily responsibilities. 
â¢	Develop and update ERA job duties, training materials, and SOPs.
â¢	Mentor, support, and provide daily guidance to employees. 
â¢	Evaluate employees work performance, prepare Performance Work Appraisals, and recommend awards, disciplinary actions, or training as appropriate.
â¢	Manage the Charter Flight Schedule; trained new personnel to update any new routes, new missions, and new updates to the schedule.
â¢	Assist and advise supervisor and office managers to provide solutions and recommendations for ICE Air Charter Operations.
â¢	Update Senior Federal Travel report and forward to management and HQ.
â¢	Manifest, review, and correct manifests, DAR reports, I-216s, and ICE Air Charter flight schedules.
â¢	Closely work with the Operations Research Analysts to identify ICE Air Charter Operations process inefficiencies.
â¢	Serve as the point of contact to management and field offices regarding any questions or errors on Air Charter flights.
â¢	Assist with Special High Risk Charter Flights (SHRCs) and inputting information in ECC.

â¢	Generate flight and charter schedules, spreadsheets, manifest, correspondence, reports, and reservations in order to prepare detainees for repatriation.
â¢	Create country clearance requests and communicate directly with multiple Attaches in order to determine necessary removal documents have been filled and or issued for detainees.
positions.title: SERA

positions.description:
â¢	Coordinated the domestic transfer movements of aliens around the country via charter and commercial aircraft from original detention facilities to final staging locations.
â¢	Provided administrative support to managers, supervisors or staff members by assisting in the day-to-day management of the officeâs activities.
â¢	Prepared Long Range International Charter (LRIC) flights and prepared officer information for travel.
â¢	Researched and abided by the Rules and Regulation Guidelines for removals.
â¢	Created weekly schedules for Charter Aircrafts to meet the Fields needs on removals. Monitored completion of daily flights and ensured all flights were manifested and prepared I-216 folders for the Flight Officer for the next day.
â¢	Organized emails from all Field Offices and managed reservations on seat requests for detainees.
â¢Managed six Field Offices on unescorted removals.  Developed travel itineraries and providing assistance in developing schedules, routes, and any special requirements in support of official travel.
positions.title: Enforcement and Removal Assistant

positions.description:
â¢	Coordinated with GEO, FUGOPS, and several other agencies to manage case dockets for the Non-Detained and Juvenile Unit. 
â¢	Coordinated all juvenile and family unit movements, to include transportation, Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR) facility placements, hotel reservations, invoicing, data tracking and statistical reporting. 
â¢	Conduct security checks for detainees using several systems.
â¢	Assisted with removal proceedings and evidence for cases.
â¢	Prepared I-205s and forward files to FUGOPS unit.
â¢	Represented the office with administrative programs, attend juvenile meetings with Deportation Officer and identify ways to improve in coordinating releases to family members.
â¢	Attended meetings with our juvenile facilities providers and suggested any new changes during these meetings.
â¢	Assisted with Order of Recognize (OREC) and Order of Supervision (OSUP) check-ins. 
â¢	Assisted Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) with interrogations and Spanish translation.
â¢	Assisted with Spanish translation and translation of documents.
â¢	Established and review case records of aliens who are detained by the agency.
â¢	Prepared and forwarded records to appropriate offices for removal and exclusion hearings.
â¢	Reviewed all Notice To Appears (NTAâs) for correct charges in accordance with regulations and instructions, prepared and forward records of proceedings to the office of Immigration review or Immigration Judge for scheduling of removal/exclusion hearings. 
â¢ Applied immigration laws to detainees and analyze immigration documents in their dockets.
â¢ Prepared warrants of deportation and determined travel document requirements
positions.title: Enforcement and Removal Assistant

positions.description:
â¢	Managed case dockets for Non-Detained and Detained Unit.
â¢	Reviewed bond cases and made determination whether or not the bond should be continued, cancelled, or breached and take appropriate action.
â¢	Analyzed case dockets and interpreted and assisted with immigration laws.
â¢	Verified citizenship of aliens and determined their immigration status.
â¢	Conducted security checks for detainees using several systems.
â¢	Reviewed and forwarded NTAâs to the Office of Chief Counsel. 
â¢	Established and reviewed case records of aliens who were detained by the agency.
â¢	Prepared warrants of deportation and determined travel document requirements.
â¢	Prepared a variety of forms, notices, and documents necessary to the detention and removal procedures.
â¢  Prepared and forwarded records to appropriate offices for removal and exclusion hearings.
â¢   Reviewed program documents for completeness and accuracy to determine appropriate action.
positions.title: Enforcement and Removal Assistant

positions.description:
â¢	Created spreadsheets, maintained records and tracked status of ATD cases.
â¢	Assisted with yearly inventory, documenting new equipment in AMOS.
â¢	Performed a variety of technical and clerical duties associating with the physical removal of aliens, including the preparation and delivery of documents, making travel arrangements and determining appropriate payment of expenses for travel documents.
â¢	Prepare office supply purchase request through the GSA website for approval.
â¢	Managed Non-Detained and Alternative to Detention Docket (ATD).
â¢	Processed bonds, made bond deposits, canceled bonds, breach bonds, and notified Burlington Finance Center of all pertinent bond transactions.
â¢	Assisted with OREC and OSUP check-ins, set new report dates for aliens.
â¢	Assisted with Spanish translation and translation of documents.
â¢	Reviewed NTAâs, reviewed charges, and forward the files to Office of Chief Counsel for hearing date.
â¢	Accessed database systems to retrieve information and add new information on detainee.
â¢	Prepared warrants of deportation and determined travel document requirements.
â¢	Prepared a variety of forms, notices, and documents necessary to the detention and removal procedure.
â¢	Prepared travel documents and making travel arrangements for domestic or international travel.
â¢	Examined detention and deportation documents for conformance with procedures and requirements and determining appropriate action.
â¢	Used multiple sources to establish identity and citizenship of detainee.
â¢	Analyzed and evaluated data from law enforcement database.
â¢	Prepared travel document package and payment for Consulate.
positions.title: Enforcement and Removal Assistant

positions.description:
â¢	Prepared master and individual hearings.
â¢	Examined and processed a variety of technical legal documents, motions, orders and pleadings.
â¢	Provided assistance to attorneys in trial preparation.
â¢	Assisted with immigration cases involving citizenship and evidence of immigration benefits.
â¢	Assisted with appeal cases and gathering information relevant to the case.
â¢	Prepared exhibits, affidavits, and other legal documents for court.
â¢	Assembled and organized files and records material for disposition or transfer to records depository.
â¢	Maintained calendar of assigned active cases.
â¢	Tracked filing, hearing, and trial dates.
â¢	Produced a variety of written documents and materials using a wide range of office software applications.
positions.title: Legal Assistant
